imports: import type { ExtractionOptions } from "@s4tk/extraction"; // TypeScript only

content.name: eventListener
content.description: A listener that is called every time an event is emitted. An arbitrary number of additional arguments may be passed as well. It is highly recommended that you make this function async.

content.name: extractSimData
content.description: Whether or not SimData should be extracted. True by default.

content.name: extractTuning
content.description: Whether or not tuning should be extracted from combined tuning. True by default.

content.name: includeDeltas
content.description: Whether or not to include delta packages. True by default. Either this or includeFullBuilds needs to be true in order to extract anything.

content.name: includeFullBuilds
content.description: Whether or not to include full packages. True by default. Either this or includeDeltas needs to be true in order to extract anything.

content.name: insertGroupComment
content.description: Whether or not to include a comment that tells the S4TK VS Code extension which group to use instead of 0. True by default.

content.name: namingConvention
content.description: Naming convention to use. "s4s" by default.

content.name: restoreComments
content.description: Whether or not comments should be added for string keys and tuning IDs. True by default.

content.name: stringManifest
content.description: The kind of manifest to generate for strings. The manifest will map string keys (hex strings) to their values. If not provided, no manifest is generated.

content.name: targetLocale
content.description: If restoring comments, this determines which language is used to restore string comments. English by default.

content.name: tuningManifest
content.description: The kind of manifest to generate for tunings. The manifest will map tuning IDs (decimal strings) to their file names. If not provided, no manifest is generated.

content.name: usePrimarySubfolders
content.description: Whether or not to use primary subfolders when writing the files. This means tuning type for tuning files, and "SimData" for SimData files. True by default.

content.name: useSecondarySubfolders
content.description: Whether or not to use secondary subfolders when writing the files. This means class for tuning files, and group for SimData files. True by default.
